content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures and only one measure. The rhythm in the score is: eighth, eighth, quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches in score A are: A3 G3, F3, E3, C3, and D3.

Score C has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures and only one measure. The rhythm in the score is: eighth, eighth, quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches in score C are: A3, G3, F sharp 3, E3, C sharp 3, and D3.

Score D has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures and only one measure. The rhythm in the score is: eighth, eighth, quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches in score D are: A3, G3, F sharp 3, E3, C3, and D3.

content.answer: Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures or time signatures and only one measure. The rhythm in the score is: eighth, eighth, quarter, eighth, eighth, and quarter. The pitches in score B are: A3, G3, F3, E flat 3, C3, and D3.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Use symbols and terms to describe features of pitch in performed music, including pitch patterns and relationships, melodic features, chords, harmonic progressions, and cadences.
